name: css-peek-pro
description: Enhanced CSS Peek extension with smart scoping that shows only relevant CSS for elements based on configurable modes - Smart, Global, Folder, or Filename matching

cssPeakPro.enabled.description: üéØ Enable CSS Peek Pro: Turn on/off the extension functionality

cssPeakPro.peekFromLanguages.description:
üî§ Supported Languages: VSCode language IDs where CSS peeking works

YOU CAN ADD YOUR OWN! To add support for Go, Zig, or any language:
1. Open VSCode Settings (Ctrl+,)
2. Search for 'CSS Peek Pro: Peek From Languages'
3. Click 'Edit in settings.json'
4. Add your language ID (e.g., 'go', 'zig', 'ruby')

To find a language ID: open a file in that language, run 'Developer: Inspect Editor Tokens and Scopes' from command palette, and look at the 'language' field.

cssPeakPro.scopingMode.description:
üéØ Scoping Mode: Choose how CSS files are discovered
‚Ä¢ Smart: Smart combination with fallback (recommended)
   - Same name files (e.g., index.html ‚Üí index.css)
   - Same folder CSS files
   - Common directories (css/, styles/, src/css/, etc.)
   - Fallback to global if no scoped files found
‚Ä¢ Global: Search entire workspace
‚Ä¢ Folder: Same directory only
‚Ä¢ Filename: Same name files (any extension)

cssPeakPro.cssFileExtensions.description:
üìÅ CSS File Extensions: Which file types to search for
Enter extensions without the dot, separated by commas
Example: css,scss,sass,less,styl

cssPeakPro.commonDirectories.description: üìÇ Common Directories: List of directory paths (relative to workspace root) to search for global styles in Smart mode

cssPeakPro.fileNamePatterns.description: üß© File Name Patterns: Patterns to match CSS files to source files in Smart/Filename mode. Use ${filename} as placeholder for the source file name (without extension).

cssPeakPro.enableHover.description: üñ±Ô∏è Enable Hover: Show CSS properties when hovering over elements, classes, and IDs

cssPeakPro.hoverDelay.description: ‚è±Ô∏è Hover Delay: Delay in milliseconds before showing hover tooltip (0-2000ms, recommended: 300-800ms)

cssPeakPro.scanDepth.description: üîç Scan Depth: Maximum directory depth to search for CSS files (1-20, higher = more files but slower)

cssPeakPro.excludeDirectories.description:
üö´ Excluded Directories: Directories to exclude from CSS file scanning
Example: node_modules,.git,target,dist,build

cssPeakPro.enableMultiWordDetection.description: üî§ Multi-word Detection: Enable detection of compound CSS selectors like 'card-title' and 'btn-primary'

cssPeakPro.enableGoToDefinition.description: üéØ Go to Definition: Enable Ctrl+Click go-to-definition for CSS selectors (like original CSS Peek)
